intro: Styphelia rectiloba, commonly known as the straight-leaved heath, is a low-growing evergreen shrub native to the coastal regions of southern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes other heaths and heather plants. The plant features small, leathery leaves that are typically arranged in a compact, mat-like form. Its flowers are usually white or pink, appearing in clusters and blooming during the cooler months. Styphelia rectiloba is well adapted to sandy, acidic soils and is often found in heathland and coastal heath ecosystems.
